item.title: ECB Cracks Down on Risks From Buyouts to Climate Under New Chair

item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Half a year into her tenure as chair of the European Central Bank’s supervisory board, Claudia Buch is destroying any hopes executives may have had for a cozier relationship with the region’s top bank regulator. Under Buch, the ECB is set to fine several banks over their protracted fa...

item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European stocks rallied most in a month as gains in tech heavyweight ASML Holding NV boosted the technology sector while investor expectations for a rate cut this week by the European Central Bank drove positive sentiment. item.author: Bloomberg News (English)

item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank confirmed that it’s preparing to fine a number of lenders after they failed to make adequate progress in addressing risks posed to their business by climate change. “We have notified a few banks that, based on our current assessment, they have not met the int...

item.title: Historic ECB Rate Cut to Drive Bull Case for Europe’s Stocks
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- A historic European Central Bank meeting this week may be the catalyst that drives regional equities to new peaks. item.title: ECB’s Inflation Challenge Looks More and More Like the Fed’s
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The uptick in euro-zone inflation is increasingly drawing comparisons to the US — fueling concern that the European Central Bank could face similar impediments to lowering interest rates as the Federal Reserve.
